validation_note: The interaction is validated. The function describing TDP-43's role in regulating the alternative splicing of HNRNPA1 pre-mRNA is well-supported by the literature. Specifically, loss of nuclear TDP-43 function leads to the inclusion of cryptic exon 7B, producing an aggregation-prone and toxic isoform, hnRNP A1B.

functions.cellular_process: TDP-43 binds to HNRNPA1 pre-mRNA and acts as a splicing repressor, preventing the inclusion of a cryptic cassette exon (exon 7B).
functions.effect_description: Under normal conditions, TDP-43 suppresses the production of hnRNP A1B, an aggregation-prone isoform with an extended prion-like domain. In TDP-43 proteinopathies, nuclear depletion of TDP-43 leads to loss of this repression, causing aberrant inclusion of exon 7B and accumulation of toxic hnRNP A1B.
biological_consequence: Loss of nuclear TDP-43 function → Aberrant inclusion of HNRNPA1 exon 7B → Production of aggregation-prone hnRNP A1B isoform → Increased cellular toxicity and neuronal death
specific_effects: Depletion of nuclear TDP-43 results in increased protein levels of the hnRNP A1B isoform.
The hnRNP A1B isoform has a higher propensity to form fibrils, drives protein aggregation, and is toxic to cells.
In ALS patients with TDP-43 pathology, hnRNP A1B accumulates in the cytoplasm of neurons.

evidence.paper_title: TDP-43 regulates the alternative splicing of hnRNP A1 to yield an aggregation-prone variant in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis
evidence.relevant_quote: Here, we report that TDP-43 binds HNRNPA1 pre-mRNA and modulates its splicing, and that depletion of nuclear TDP-43 results in increased inclusion of a cassette exon in the HNRNPA1 transcript...
evidence.authors: Deshaies JE,㞒Sivakumar V, Moser J, Loffreda A, Healey-Bird J, Barmada SJ, Shorter J, Rossoll W, Vande Velde C

evidence.paper_title: TDP-43 mutations increase HNRNP A1-7B through gain of splicing function
evidence.relevant_quote: Although our findings may differ from Deshaies et al. on how TDP-43 loss-of-function impacts on HNRNPA1 splicing, both our data and Deshaies et al. support a link between TDP-43, the HNRNP A1-7B isoform and ALS.
evidence.authors: Sivakumar A, Malpetti M, Ranzoni M, Hummel S, Rubeis G, D'Amico E, Malaspina A, Fratta P

mechanism: TDP-43 binds to HNRNPA1 pre-mRNA and acts as a splicing repressor, preventing the inclusion of a cryptic cassette exon (exon 7B).
effect: Under normal conditions, TDP-43 suppresses the production of hnRNP A1B, an aggregation-prone isoform with an extended prion-like domain. In TDP-43 proteinopathies, nuclear depletion of TDP-43 leads to loss of this repression, causing aberrant inclusion of exon 7B and accumulation of toxic hnRNP A1B.
summary: TDP43 inhibits hnRNP A1 to modulate repression of hnrnpa1 exon 7b splicing, ultimately affecting increased cellular toxicity and neuronal death.
